Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.

- Financial Concepts Accuracy: The student correctly stated the WACC components and formula, computed CAPM cost of equity (11.65%), after-tax cost of debt (5.8%·(1–0.21)), market-value weights, and derived WACC (11.22%), then interpreted and applied it to project decisions. Implementation and reflection evidence show both computational accuracy and applied understanding, meeting the thoroughness required for PASS.
- Financial Concepts Accuracy: The student correctly applied the after-tax debt formula and computed 4.582%, explicitly explained why debt is cheaper via the tax shield, and used this to analyze peer differences and capital-structure adjustments. Implementation and reflection evidence show both computational accuracy and applied understanding, meeting the PASS threshold.

- Technical Implementation: The student correctly identifies and applies the CAPM formula and reports a plausible numeric result, showing conceptual understanding.
